title: First, note cosine is an even function, so we can wrtie $$cos\left(\frac{11\pi}{12}\right)$$. Next, express $$\frac{11\pi}{12}$$ as a half-angle by solving $$\frac{\theta}{2}$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{11\pi}{2}$$.

The half-angle formula for cosine is $$\operatorname{cosin}\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)=\sqrt{\frac{1+cos\left(\theta\right)}{2}}$$ (plus or minus). Since $$\frac{11\pi}{12}$$ is in quadrant II, we pick the negative half-angle formula.
Plug in our half-angle into this equation and solve.
